intro: Helicostylis ojoche, commonly known as the Ojoche helicostylis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant features a short, stocky rhizome with a single, broad, arrowhead-shaped leaf that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Helicostylis ojoche is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
